item.title: LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight: üîóComposability A big part of LangChain v0.1.0 is composability. We achieve this by using LangChain Expression Language ...
item.description:
LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight:

üîóComposability

A big part of LangChain v0.1.0 is composability. We achieve this by using LangChain Expression Language - which we've been working on for the past six months

This allows you to compose arbitrary sequences of LLM calls, function‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745149486576644197

item.title: ü¶úLangChain <> DSPyüß© DSPy is a fantastic framework that **compiles** your LLM program Specifically, the DSPy compiler will internally trace your ...
item.description:
ü¶úLangChain <> DSPyüß©

DSPy is a fantastic framework that **compiles** your LLM program

Specifically, the DSPy compiler will internally trace your program and then craft high-quality prompts for large LMs to teach them the steps of your task.

Thanks to @lateinteraction we have‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745138590429163941
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Kpolley: Since this post, I learned about @LangChainAI and turned this POC notebook into a web chat UI interface, GitChat. demo: https://gitchat.kp...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇKpolley
Since this post, I learned about @LangChainAI and turned this POC notebook into a web chat UI interface, GitChat.

demo: https://gitchat.kpolley.com
demo share: https://gitchat.kpolley.com/share/FrAT0ak

The goal is for GitChat to be deployed internally at organizations as a helpful, secure,‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745138173846385107


Kpolley:‚ÄÇI created a chatbot that can search and understand @runpanther's public threat detection repo. It was wildly easier to do than I expected!

Every DevX team should be exploring how fine-tuned, internally-facing AIs can improve the engineering and operations experience. This is so‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1730314234246865209

item.title: RT DeepLearning.AI: New short course with @LangChainAI: Build LLM Apps with LangChain.js. Explore LangChain.js, a top JavaScript framework for buildin...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇDeepLearning.AI
New short course with @LangChainAI: Build LLM Apps with LangChain.js.

Explore LangChain.js, a top JavaScript framework for building with LLMs, learn to retrieve and present data to the LLM for a conversational retrieval chain, and more.

Sign up for free: https://hubs.la/Q02f-f7M0

item.description:

üß± Structured Output LCEL Chains üß±

item.title: üéèüï∏Ô∏èStreaming with LangGraph Yesterday, we introduced LangGraph as way to construct language agents as graphs Because this is built on LangChain...
item.description:
üéèüï∏Ô∏èStreaming with LangGraph

Yesterday, we introduced LangGraph as way to construct language agents as graphs

Because this is built on LangChain, it comes with the ability to stream intermediate steps as well as tokens

Check it out: https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHard Kothari
After making it easy to build orchestrated steps (chains) easy using LCEL, @LangChainAI has once again introduced new feature of LangGraphs to make it easy to work with agents.

The idea behind is to make it more modular and easy to work with agents and building them with more‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744735659846438921

item.title: RT Michael Struwig ü¶ã: The most interesting thing about the @LangChainAI v0.1 announcement is the release of `langgraph` (https://github.com/langcha...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇMichael Struwig ü¶ã
The most interesting thing about the @LangChainAI v0.1 announcement is the release of `langgraph` (https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph), which allows you to compose reasoning "workflows" in a graph-like fashion, where the agent is able to make decisions on which steps to take next.

If‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744696099141517752
